page.title: 01Mowsley & Laughton D-Block
page.content: Our D-Block is agricultural land with the villages of Mowsley in the West and Laughton in the East. Leicester City is about 12 miles North. Most of the land is above 125 metres, the highest point is 168 metres. The{ {landscape}is attractive rolling hills of loam, clay, and gravel containing many{springs.}Between the villages is a sewage plant, and within the block are Laughton and Gumley cricket pitches. The villages have Anglican churches; Mowsley has a small primary school and a pub. The Mowsley to Laughton road is crossed by the North/South road from Saddington to Theddingworth. A road also leads East to Lubenham. The area is crossed by two streams and the Grand Union{Canal.}In the North is the tip of Saddington{reservoir}used for leisure and refilling the canal.
